casebody.data:
Pappenheim, Respondent, v. Metropolitan El. Ry. Co. et al., Appellants. (Superior Court of New York City, General Term. January 5, 1891.) Appeal from equity term. Action by Lena Pappenheim against the Metropolitan Elevated Railway Company and another for damages resulting from the operation of defendants’ railroad in the street in front of plaintiff’s premises, and for an injunction. From a judgment for plaintiff, defendants appeal. For former report, see 7 N. Y. Supp. 679.

Argued before Freedman and Ingraham, JJ.

Davies, Short c6 Townsend, for appellants. Sackett & Bennett, for respondent. Per Curiam.

The judgment should be affirmed, with costs.
